seg.seg: ... this (stro)phe the Buddha (spoke), to keep [the beings] from evil [and] (to tie) [them] (to) the virtues. [50b] ... or (evil), of just this [he is] consuming the [inherited] part
[50d] (This strophe) he proclaimed to them. What the beings will do here, good [and] evil deed ... the [inherited] part [of it] they will consume in the births.
Was die Wesen hier tun, gute [und] bö(se Tat), ... das [Erb]teil [davon] werden sie in den Geburten verzehren.
What[ever] the beings are doing here, good [and] ba(d deed), ... [their] share [of this inheritance] they will consume in [their] births.
... not another one. [51d] At again another time good .... The king of Magadha, A(jātaśatru),
... through instigation [by his] bad friend Devadatta. [52d] ... he locked [him] into prison. Food [and] drink
... and (cut) [his] feet (off) with a knife. After that (he ordered?) to release (him) ... (53d). Of this matter Prasannake (the king) heard.
... to the Ajātaśatru. Thereupon the (king?) of Magadha ....[54d] Three times Pra(sannaka) came
... (Ajātaśatru) threw the army of the Kausalas. This very much annoyed the Pra(sannaka) ... “he will, after all, take Śrāvastī”. [55d]
... (Ajātaśatru) warf das Heer der Kausalas. Sehr verdross das den Par(sannaka).
... (Ajātaśatru) threw the army of the kausalas. This very much annoyed Pra(sannaka).
... This one came (to the) king and invited the king to [his] possessions ... will do service
Er kam (zum) König [und] bot dem König [seinen] Besitz an.
He came (to) the king [and] offered [his] possessions to the king.
... [56d] ... (without) number he gave gold and (possessions), great ... without number
... [57d] And the king sent an explanation to the four regions of the world ... when by age he (is prevented), from the house
... with one another, directed in a single direction. [58d] Padmakesara by name, (the military leader) ... the king Prasannaka. All
... these as one in the middle. To the front [are] to be put those, that ... [59d] ... (Ajātaśa)tru, the king, very much. Monks ...
... of the fight. With the bad ones first .... their power will recede completely. [60d]
... having exterted themselves with little effort the enemies will fall ... the (Ajātaśa)tru. With a great army the king
... [61d] (Prasanna)ka (moved) against the king of Magadha. They fought each other ... (and taken captive, the king) of Magadha. He bound him
... [62d] To see the Buddha, the king Prasannaka went ... (“Caught was?) by me, o Omniscient, the terrible enemy.

p.note: Includes strophes 50 – 63 of the Karmavarga (IX) in a 4x12 syllable-metre (rhythm = 5/4/3). Between the two fragments on average 12-16 syllables are missing, while the top of the leaf, containing about 6-10 syllables is lost entirely.

The original manuscript is missing, but consisted of two non-continuous fragments, one being a piece from the centre of the leaf, beginning at the schnurloch, the other a remnant of the leaf's right side.
For śawāñc= ailñe and ailñe śūwaṃ rendering Skt. dāyāda- "eating/consuming heritage" > "suffering the bad consequences of bad deeds", see .

kausalṣets for kausalṣents; eṅtär for eṅktär.
The reading orocce ti might be read as orocce to according to 51 fn. 18.
